author: Fe Online
title: BMC Elections Results 2017: BJP may form alliance with Shiv Sena if needed, hints Kirit Somaaiya - The Financial Express
text:
BMC Elections Results 2017: BJP may form alliance with Shiv Sena if needed, hints Kirit Somaaiya BMC Elections Results 2017: BJP may form alliance with Shiv Sena if needed, hints Kirit Somaaiya BMC Elections Results 2017: Bhartiya Janata Party leader and Member of Parliament Kirit Somaaiya has hinted that if required his party can go on an alliance with Shiv Sena after the Mumbai Civic Polls, results of which are being declared today. By: FE Online | Mumbai | Updated: February 23, 2017 4:00 PM BMC Elections Results 2017: BJP MP Kirit Somaiya’s son Neil wins from ward number 108. (ANI) 
BMC Elections Results 2017: Bharatiya Janata Party leader and Member of Parliament Kirit Somaaiya has hinted that if required his party can go on an alliance with Shiv Sena after the Mumbai Civic Polls, results of which are being declared today. Speaking to reporters, the senior party leader said that the transparency and development should be the common agenda and his party would do anything for the wellfare of the people of Mumbai. His son Neil, contesting from BJP , won from ward number 108. 
Earlier in the day, Shiv Sena Member of Parliament Anil Desai told reporters that there are several places in the city where the Shiv Sena is leading, which is due to peoples faith on late late Balasaheb Thackeray and his son Uddhav. When asked about aharashtra BJP president Raosaheb Danve’s visit to ‘Matoshree’ where Uddhav Thackeray lives, he said that it was a personal one. 
Both parties had engaged in a high campaign for the Mumbai civic polls with the alliance partners accusing each other. The Congress party, which which was in distant third after the Sena and the BJP put the blame of the party’s internal differences of the party for its miserable performance. Senior party leader Narayan Rane said that when elections wer announced he had predicted that Shiv Sena would get maximum seats, now it has to be seen whether they get full majority. “But the way BJP was campaigning and how the Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis insulted Uddhav Thackeray was not the way, Mumbaikars did not like, he said. 
You may also like to watch this video 
He further said that the Congress lost out because of internal differences among its leaders. Leaders did not come together, he added. 
(With inputs from PTI)
